images.caption:
Figure 1.NoTeeline enables users to take notes while watching videoson-the-flyby automatically converting briefmicronotesinto fully-expanded notes in their writing style.
While watching a video, the user jots down quick keypoints (a). NoTeeline retrieves the transcript at the timestamp (b). In addition, NoTeeline references a small collection of the user’s previous notes (c). Given (b) and (c), NoTeeline automatically expands the micronote into a complete note in their writing style (1). Inspired by the Cornell notetaking system(Saran et al.,2022), NoTeeline generates review questions (2), a brief summary (3), and groups notes into key themes (4) to assist users in note review.

Figure 2.The NoTeeline user interface consists of (a) theCuespanel (outlined in blue) for review questions generated based on the notes, (b) theNotespanel (outlined in orange) for user notetaking and note expansion, and (c) theSummarypanel (outlined in purple) for note summary. The layout is inspired by the Cornell method, as seen in the side-by-side comparison. The onboarding session, highlighted on the left, collects example notes from the user.
Figure 3.Micronote expansion. Users can toggle between the micronote and the expanded note by clicking theExpand/Reducebuttons.
Figure 4.Note organization by themes (some texts have been cropped for clarity). Users can organize the notes by themes or toggle back to the original serial in which they took the notes.

Figure 5.Distribution of pause and skips used by each participant in NoTeeline (left) and Baseline (right). In NoTeeline, the count of pause and skip is significantly less than the baseline. An empty bar depicts that the user did not pause or skip at all.

Figure 8.Composition Characteristic curve(Mendenhall,1887)for P9. The onboarding session examples help NoTeeline generate notes in a similar style that user would write themselves (the lower the gap between two curves, the higher the stylistic similarity)

Figure 8.Composition Characteristic curve(Mendenhall,1887)for P9. The onboarding session examples help NoTeeline generate notes in a similar style that user would write themselves (the lower the gap between two curves, the higher the stylistic similarity)
Figure 10.Participants’ responses to utility and usability of NoTeeline interface and various features (7-point Likert scale, higher is better).
Figure 11.Different tools and techniques participants reported to use for note-taking in their daily lives.
Figure 11.Different tools and techniques participants reported to use for note-taking in their daily lives.
